verses.verse: Judge<WH8199> me, O God<WH430>, and plead<WH7378> my cause<WH7379> against an ungodly<WH3808> <WH2623> nation<WH1471>: O deliver<WH6403> me from the deceitful<WH4820> and unjust<WH5766> man<WH376>. ungodly: or, unmerciful the deceitful: Heb. a man of deceit and iniquity
For thou art the God<WH430> of my strength<WH4581>: why dost thou cast me off<WH2186>? why go<WH1980> I mourning<WH6937> because of the oppression<WH3906> of the enemy<WH341>?
O send out<WH7971> thy light<WH216> and thy truth<WH571>: let them lead<WH5148> me; let them bring<WH935> me unto thy holy<WH6944> hill<WH2022>, and to thy tabernacles<WH4908>.

Then will I go<WH935> unto the altar<WH4196> of God<WH430>, unto God<WH410> my exceeding<WH8057> joy<WH1524>: yea, upon the harp<WH3658> will I praise<WH3034> thee, O God<WH430> my God<WH430>. my exceeding: Heb. the gladness of my joy

Why art thou cast down<WH7817>, O my soul<WH5315>? and why art thou disquieted<WH1993> within me? hope<WH3176> in God<WH430>: for I shall yet praise<WH3034> him, who is the health<WH3444> of my countenance<WH6440>, and my God<WH430>.
